newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso ends soft ahead of long U.S. weekend.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso ends soft ahead of long U.S. weekend.

text.p: The Mexican peso closed weaker on Friday due to dealers covering short dollar positions ahead of a long weekend in U.S. markets and month-end corporate demand for greenbacks, traders said.
"Foreign dealers squared positions ahead of the long weekend," a trader said.
The benchmark 48-hour peso and its 24-hour stablemate ended 2.1 and 2.4 centavos weaker, respectively, at 7.8780/7.8810 and 7.8730/7.8780 per dollar.
The 48-hour contract had nonetheless firmed 1.5 centavos on the week.
U.S. financial markets will remain closed on Monday, May 26, for Memorial Day.

Dealers said trading was slow on Friday, and expected it to be slower still on Monday, due to the U.S. holdiday. They said the peso could weaken further, however, due to continued demand for dollars by corporations that have to meet month-end foreign currency obligations.
The same-day peso will not trade on Monday.
Same-day peso contracts had closed mid-morning 0.6 of a centavo firmer at 7.8620/7.8650 per dollar.
